my_float_t simple_rmsd (const CoordFile &f1, const CoordFile &f2)
 Simple rmsd.

Detailed Description

NOTE: Once a molecule is read NEVER modify the underlying vectors or arrays or you will endure the immense pain of invalidated iterators. At the present this is entirely reasonable because we are not in the business of growing or shrinking molecules.

Member Function Documentation

const bool SimSite3D::CoordFile::atoms_overlap ( const atom_t &  a,
const atom_t &  b 
) const [inline, private]

Check if the atoms have significant and undesireable overlap.

Special rules exist to allow atoms that are participating in hydrogen bonds to be closer than would otherwise be tolerated. A similar rule exists for acceptor and metal interactions.

Parameters:
a Reference to the ligand or probe atom
b Reference to the protein atom (or metal)
Returns:
True if there is significant and undesireable overlap between a and b

atom_vi SimSite3D::CoordFile::atoms_storage_begin (  )  [inline, protected]

The name of this function is purposely changed because it using the name atoms_begin() causes g++ to not know which function to choose

atom_vi SimSite3D::CoordFile::atoms_storage_end (  )  [inline, protected]

Allow derived classes to modify the atoms via iterators -- end of the point_storage class

bool SimSite3D::CoordFile::overlapping_atoms ( const atom_t &  a,
std::vector< atom_vci > *  overlaps 
) [inline]

Find all protein atoms that overlap atom a.

The purpose of this method is mainly a development/testing method that allows one to see all atoms that have significant overlap with atom a.

Parameters:
a Reference to the atom that is near the protein
overlaps Pointer to a vector to hold the iterators to the atoms that significantly overlap atom a.
Returns:
True if there is at least one significant overlap, else false.

const bool SimSite3D::CoordFile::overlapping_atoms ( const atom_t &  a  )  const [inline]

Parameters:
a Reference to the atom that is near the protein
Returns:
True if there is at least one significant overlap, else false.
